p: Pneumonia type may be secondary to the simplex type or occurs as primary influenza virus pneumonia, which is caused by spread of influenza virus from upper respiratory tract to lower respiratory tract. The pneumonia type commonly occurs in the elderly, children, patients with underlying heart and/or lung disease, pregnancies, and individuals with compromised immunity. The main manifestations include persistent high fever, difficulty breathing, cynosis, severe cough, expectoration of foamy mucous sputum or purulent sputum, expectoration of sputum with blood.
